description: Largest number such that n=m^a(n)-a(n) with m a positive integer; i.e. where (n+a(n))^(1/a(n)) is a positive integer.
comments: It may be that positive integers can be written as n=m^k-k (with m and k > 1) in at most one way [checked up to 10000] as well as with k=1 and m=n+1.
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 26 2000
